qas.question: In 1876, how many preachers were expelled from the Dominican Order?
In 1910, how many Dominicans were actively engaged in Order work?
How many Dominican friars were there in 2013?
In what year were there 4,470 priests in the Dominican Order?
How many student brothers were there in the year 2000?
How many preachers were expelled from the Dominican Order in 1867?
How many Dominicans were actively engages in Order work in 1867?
How many Dominican friars were there in 2018?
What year were there 5,570 priests in the Dominican Order?
How many students were there in the year 2001?

context: During this critical period, the number of Preachers seems never to have sunk below 3,500. Statistics for 1876 show 3,748, but <a0_0><b5_0>500<b5_0/><a0_0/> of these had been expelled from their convents and were engaged in parochial work. Statistics for 1910 show a total of <a1_0><b6_0>4,472<b6_0/><a1_0/> nominally or actually engaged in proper activities of the order. In the year 2000, there were 5,171 Dominican friars in solemn vows, <a4_0><b9_0>917<b9_0/><a4_0/> student brothers, and 237 novices. By the year <a3_0><b8_0>2013<b8_0/><a3_0/> there were <a2_0><b7_0>6058<b7_0/><a2_0/> Dominican friars, including 4,470 priests.
